bridge.toolkit.util
Class StylesheetApplier

java.lang.Object
  bridge.toolkit.util.StylesheetApplier

public class StylesheetApplier
extends java.lang.Object

Provides the ability to apply style sheets to the data modules.

Constructor Summary

Method Summary
 void applyStylesheetToDMCs(java.io.File iBaseDir, java.lang.String iStyleSheet)
          Applies the appropriate XSLT style sheet to the S1000D data modules so that they will be rendered in a human readable format in the SCORM Content Package SCOs.

Method Detail

applyStylesheetToDMCs

public void applyStylesheetToDMCs(java.io.File iBaseDir,
                                  java.lang.String iStyleSheet)
                           throws org.jdom.JDOMException,
                                  java.io.IOException
Applies the appropriate XSLT style sheet to the S1000D data modules so that they will be rendered in a human readable format in the SCORM Content Package SCOs.

Parameters:
iBaseDir - File that is the base directory for the data modules.
iStyleSheet - String that represents the location of the style sheet to be added.
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException
java.io.IOException

applyStylesheetToDMCs

public void applyStylesheetToDMCs(java.io.File iBaseDir,
                                  java.lang.String iStyleSheet,
                                  java.lang.String iType,
                                  java.lang.String iMediaType)
                           throws org.jdom.JDOMException,
                                  java.io.IOException
Applies the appropriate XSLT style sheet to the S1000D data modules so that they will be rendered in a human readable format in the SCORM Content Package SCOs.

Parameters:
iBaseDir - File that is the base directory for the data modules.
iStyleSheet - String that represents the location of the style sheet to be added.
iType - String that represents the style sheet type. Either 'xsl' or 'css'.
iMediaType - String that represents the entire media type attribute if needed to be included.
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException
java.io.IOException

formatDocType

public org.jdom.DocType formatDocType(org.jdom.DocType docT,
                                      java.io.File dm)
                               throws java.io.IOException
Formats the internal subset of the DocType of the S1000D data modules so that they will render the correct content.

Parameters:
docT - DocType object after the JDOM SAXBuilder parses the data module.
dm - File object that represents the location of the data module file being modified.
Returns:
DocType object with the absolute paths removed from the internal subset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
